form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mrs. Boxer(for herself,Mr. Coburn,Ms. Baldwin, andMr. Paul) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to theCommittee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

form.official-title: To amend the Public Health Service Act to establish safeguards and standards of quality for research and transplantation of organs infected with human immunodeficiency virus (HIV).

section.text: This Act may be cited as the HIV Organ Policy Equity Act .

section.header: Amendments to the Public Health Service Act

subsection.header: Standards of quality for the acquisition and transportation of donated organs

paragraph.text: Section 372(b) of the Public Health Service Act(42 U.S.C. 274(b))is amended—

subparagraph.text: inparagraph (2)(E), by striking, including standards for preventing the acquisition of organs that are infected with the etiologic agent for acquired immune deficiency syndrome; and
by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: In adopting and using standards of quality underparagraph (2)(E), the Organ Procurement and Transplantation Network may adopt and use such standards with respect to organs infected with human immunodeficiency virus (HIV), provided that any such standards ensure that organs infected with human immunodeficiency virus may be transplanted only into individuals who are infected with such virus before receiving such organ.

Section 371(b)(3)(C) of the Public Health Service Act(42 U.S.C. 273(b)(3)(C) ; relating to organ procurement organizations) is amended by strikingincluding arranging for testing with respect to preventing the acquisition of organs that are infected with the etiologic agent for acquired immune deficiency syndromeand insertingincluding arranging for testing with respect to identifying organs that are infected with human immunodeficiency virus (HIV).

subsection.text: Part H of title III of the Public Health Service Act(42 U.S.C. 273 et seq.)is amended by inserting aftersection 377Dthe following:

section.header: Guidelines, standards, and regulations with respect to organs infected with HIV

subsection.text: Not later than 1 year after the date of the enactment of the HIV Organ Policy Equity Act , theSecretaryshall develop and publish guidelines for the conduct of research relating to transplantation of organs from donors infected with human immunodeficiency virus (in this section referred to asHIV).

subsection.header: Corresponding changes to standards and regulations applicable to research
subsection.text: Not later than 1 year after the date of the enactment of the HIV Organ Policy Equity Act , to the extent determined by theSecretaryto be necessary to allow the conduct of research in accordance with the guidelines developed undersubsection (a)—

paragraph.text: the Organ Procurement and Transplantation Network shall revise the standards of quality adopted undersection 372(b)(2)(E); and
theSecretaryshall revise section 121.6 of title 42, Code of Federal Regulations (or any successor regulations).

subsection.header: Revision of standards and regulations generally
subsection.text: Not later than 2 years after the date of the enactment of the HIV Organ Policy Equity Act , and annually thereafter, theSecretary, shall—

paragraph.text: review the results of scientific research in conjunction with the Organ Procurement and Transplantation Network to determine whether the results warrant revision of the standards of quality adopted undersection 372(b)(2)(E)with respect to donated organs infected with HIV and with respect to the safety of cross-strain transplantation;

if theSecretarydetermines underparagraph (1)that such results warrant revision of the standards of quality adopted undersection 372(b)(2)(E)with respect to donated organs infected with HIV and with respect to cross-strain transplantation, direct the Organ Procurement and Transplantation Network to revise such standards, consistent withsection 372and in a way that ensures the changes will not reduce the safety of organ transplantation; and

in conjunction with any revision of such standards underparagraph (2), shall revise section 121.6 of title 42, Code of Federal Regulations (or any successor regulations) for consistency with such standards.

section.header: Conforming amendment to title 18 of the United States Code
section.text: Section 1122 of title 18, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

subsection.text: An organ donation does not violate this section if the donation is in accordance with all applicable guidelines and regulations of theSecretarymade undersection 377E of the Public Health Service Act.
